title: The Yambuk Slide
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.

abstract: Welcome to Yambuk, home of the famous Yambuk Slide. Filmed as part of 'ACMI in the Regions: Stories from Moyne'.
description: The Yambuk Slide is a local icon, a place where generations have come to enjoy the freedom and fun that a slide in the middle of a sand dune can deliver. Originally built in 1982, when the slide was likely to be removed it caused much upset with the locals, one threatening to chain himself to the slide.  The new slide does not have the speed of the old one, but it still keeps kids entertained and parents happy.
